summary: The National Veterans Advocate Act of 2025 seeks to improve advocacy for veterans receiving healthcare and benefits from the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). It establishes an independent Office of the National Veterans' Advocate, who reports directly to the Secretary and oversees casework. The bill outlines functions of the office, including monitoring VA processes, making recommendations to Congress, identifying veteran issues, and proposing solutions. It mandates reports to Congress, establishes a website for casework requests, and requires outreach to veterans. Finally, it addresses training for veteran advocates and authorizes appropriations for the office.
